intro: Micranthes parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved pipsissewa, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, opposite, ovate leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. Its flowers are tiny, greenish-white, and clustered in short, racemose inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
